Source code for havoc.autotest_testfiles.validation_utils.lib.gpusetup

from __future__ import absolute_import
from __future__ import division
from __future__ import print_function
from __future__ import unicode_literals
from validation_utils.lib.autoval import AutovalUtils
import os
import shutil
import logging
import sys
sys.path.append(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..", "..",))



[docs]class GPUSetup:


[docs]    @classmethod
    def nvidia_driver(self,
                      replace_nvidia_driver=False,
                      nvidia_driver_path='/mnt/vol/havoc/autoval/bin/gpu/NVIDIA-Linux-x86_64-352.60-custom.run',
                      nvidia_install_cmd='./NVIDIA-Linux-x86_64-352.60-custom.run --silent'):
        # Check if NVIDIA driver is installed, install if necessary
        try:
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output('lsmod | grep nvidia')
        except Exception:
            logging.info(
                "NVIDIA driver not Installed, installing NVIDIA driver"
            )
            tmpdir = os.getcwd()
            shutil.copy(nvidia_driver_path, tmpdir)
            os.chdir(tmpdir)
            try:
                AutovalUtils.run_get_output(nvidia_install_cmd)
            except Exception:
                logging.info('NVIDIA install failed')
                return False
            else:
                logging.info('NVIDIA install succeeded')
        else:
            if replace_nvidia_driver is False:
                logging.info(
                    "NVIDIA driver already installed, skipping installation"
                )
            else:
                logging.info(
                    "Installing new NVIDIA driver"
                )
                tmpdir = os.getcwd()
                shutil.copy(nvidia_driver_path, tmpdir)
                os.chdir(tmpdir)
                try:
                    AutovalUtils.run_get_output(nvidia_install_cmd)
                except Exception:
                    logging.info('NVIDIA install failed')
                    return False
                else:
                    logging.info('NVIDIA install succeeded')
        return True



[docs]    @classmethod
    def cuda_driver(self,
                    replace_cuda_driver=False,
                    cuda_driver_path='/mnt/vol/havoc/autoval/bin/gpu/cuda_7.5.18_linux.run',
                    cuda_install_cmd='sh ./cuda_7.5.18_linux.run --silent --toolkit --samples'):
        tmpdir = os.getcwd()
        # check if cuda is installed
        cuda_ver = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(
            'cat /usr/local/cuda/version.txt',
            ignore_status=True
        )

        if 'CUDA Version' in cuda_ver and replace_cuda_driver is False:
            logging.info("CUDA already Installed - %s" % cuda_ver)
            return True
        else:
            logging.info("Installing CUDA")
            shutil.copy(cuda_driver_path, tmpdir)
            os.chdir(tmpdir)
            AutovalUtils.run_get_output(cuda_install_cmd)

            cuda_ver = AutovalUtils.run_get_output(
                'cat /usr/local/cuda/version.txt'
            )
            logging.info("CUDA Installed - %s" % cuda_ver)
            return True



[docs]    @classmethod
    def cuda_build_sample(self,
                          cuda_sample_library_link='echo "/usr/local/cuda-7.5/lib64/" > /etc/ld.so.conf.d/cuda.conf'):
        # Make sure correct libraries linked for CUDA samples
        AutovalUtils.run_get_output(
            cuda_sample_library_link
        )
        AutovalUtils.run_get_output('ldconfig')

        # Build cuda samples
        logging.info("Building CUDA samples")
        tmp_dir = os.getcwd()
        os.chdir('/usr/local/cuda/samples/')
        AutovalUtils.run_get_output('make')
        logging.info("CUDA samples compiled")
        os.chdir(tmp_dir)
        return True
